meanings.definition: The skill or practice of managing public affairs.
meanings.sent1: Her statesmanship was evident in the way she handled the crisis.
meanings.sent2: His statesmanship was admired by all for its wisdom and diplomacy.
meanings.sent3: The cat showed great statesmanship in negotiating for more treats.
meanings.sent4: His statesmanship was a beacon of hope in the turbulent sea of politics.
meanings.sent5: The statesmanship of the firefighter saved many lives during the rescue mission.

meanings.definition: The qualities of a good statesman.
meanings.sent1: The president's statesmanship was evident in his speeches.
meanings.sent2: She displayed true statesmanship in her leadership role.
meanings.sent3: The clown's statesmanship in juggling was truly impressive.
meanings.sent4: His statesmanship shone through in times of crisis.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's statesmanship in guiding her students was remarkable.
